Summary Note:
The RM is Ilona Daantje Krol's brother-in-law, having married her's sister. This family connection has strengthened their professional collaboration, allowing for seamless communication and trust.
Ilona Daantje Krol is a 69 year old retired Museum Director from Netherlands. She has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
She was drawn to Julius Baer's holistic financial planning and investment strategies, prompting the decision to join.
Family Background: Ilona Daantje Krol and Veenhoven have been married since 1988. Ilona and Veenhoven have 2 children, named Snijders and Tess.
Education Background:
In 1975, Ilona finished her secondary school education at Oosterlicht College Groningen.
Ilona completed her university studies at Willem de Kooning Academy in 1980.
Occupation History:
Ilona Daantje Krol is a 69 year old and comes from Netherlands.
Ilona Daantje Krol's first role was as a Art Dealer at Van Gogh Museum, where she worked diligently from 1980 to 1983 to establish a strong reputation.
After gaining experience, she took on the role of Gallery Owner at Mauritshuis in 1985, further expanding her skill set.
At Van Gogh Museum, she worked as a Art Advisor from 1989 to 1991, focusing on strategic initiatives and team collaboration.
In 1992, she transitioned to Van Gogh Museum to take on the position of Curator, capitalizing on her expertise to propel business growth.
Until retiring, Ilona Daantje Krol served as a Museum Director at Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam, contributing significantly from 1996 to 2016.
Wealth Summary:
While working, she saved 2370000 EUR, which she used to build a diversified investment portfolio.
She has invested in several rental properties across various locations, generating additional income. The properties are valued at 3010000 EUR.

She does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: The RM is very happy to have Ilona as a customer and is looking forward to a long and successful cooperation.
